entries.title: Can floating turbines harvest the world's wind?
entries.description: Our climate editor checks out the world's largest floating wind farm off the coast of Scotland.

entries.title: Lyon 1-5 Arsenal: A special night for Gunners as they humble Champions League holders
entries.description: Arsenal's 5-1 win over Champions League holders Lyon is seen as a result that could "shift the whole balance of the women's game".

entries.title: Teachers join Jamie Oliver free school meals call
entries.description: Pressure builds on the government as a campaign to expand eligibility for free school meals grows.

entries.title: Malorie Blackman calls for year-round black history in schools
entries.description: The Noughts and Crosses author says schools should teach "whole-truth" black history all year round.

entries.title: Suella Braverman quits and vote chaos add to turmoil for the PM
entries.description: The resignation of a senior minister and anger over a vote on fracking pile even more pressure on the prime minister.

entries.title: Black Death 700 years ago affects your health now
entries.description: Mutations that saved lives from the plague are causing auto-immune diseases today.

entries.title: Chris Mason: So what are the PM's options now?
entries.description: One senior Tory MP said Liz Truss' actions have been "unforgivable," "terrible" and "appalling".

entries.title: US reminds pro-Putin Hungary it's a Western ally
entries.description: The US embassy hits back at anti-American remarks from Viktor Orban's government over the Ukraine war.

entries.title: India's virtual stars whose real faces you won't see
entries.description: 'Virtual YouTubers' or VTubers use quirky digital avatars to mask their identities online.

entries.title: General practice is like calling an Uber, MPs say
entries.description: A cross-party group says patients are receiving an unacceptably poor service amid a shortage of GPs.

entries.title: Midnights: What we know about Taylor Swift's songwriting
entries.description: The star's sound is constantly evolving - but she's always been happy to share her secrets with fans.

entries.title: Ethiopia's Tigray conflict: Nasa shows how a war zone faded from space
entries.description: Images of nights skies show power supplies disappearing in Ethiopia as a humanitarian crisis bites.

entries.title: Ukrainians told to 'charge everything' as power grid hit by Russia
entries.description: Ukraine's grid operator warns of many power cuts after Russian missiles damaged energy facilities.

entries.title: Plan to ensure some services run during strikes
entries.description: Unions say the government's plan, which follows months of industrial action, is "doomed".

entries.title: People plan for smaller Christmas as prices soar
entries.description: Inflation returned to a 40-year high in September as a BBC survey suggests people are cutting spending.

entries.title: Match of the Day analysis: How 'front-foot' Bruno Fernandes was back to his Man Utd best
entries.description: Match of the Day pundits Gary Lineker & Micah Richards discuss how Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes was back to his best in their 2-0 victory over Tottenham in the Premier League.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Truss on the brink' and 'chaos' of Braverman exit
entries.description: Suella Braverman's resignation during a chaotic day at Westminster leads most of the papers.

entries.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Erik ten Hag will 'deal with' Man Utd forward over early exit down tunnel
entries.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says he will "deal with" Cristiano Ronaldo after the unused substitute walked down the tunnel before the end of the win over Tottenham.

entries.title: Ukrainian troops under close gunfire
entries.description: The front line in eastern Ukraine involves not only artillery strikes, but also close quarters combat, as the BBC's Jonathan Beale finds out.

entries.title: Westminster chaos continues...in 70 seconds
entries.description: A blistering resignation, a new home secretary and allegations of bullying as another chaotic day unfolds.

entries.title: Newcastle United 1-0 Everton: Miguel Almiron strike sees Magpies underline top-six credentials
entries.description: Newcastle underline their top-six credentials by beating Everton thanks to Miguel Almiron's fifth goal of the season.

entries.title: Lyon 1-5 Arsenal: Gunners stun Champions League holders with brilliant away performance
entries.description: Arsenal put in a phenomenal performance to beat Women's Champions League holders Lyon with goals from Caitlin Foord, Frida Maanum and Beth Mead.

entries.title: Man Utd 2-0 Tottenham: Bruno Fernandes & Fred goals see Red Devils beat Spurs
entries.description: Manchester United produce arguably their finest performance under manager Erik ten Hag as Tottenham are swept aside at Old Trafford.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: Wales 12-18 Cook Islands - Steve Marsters seals Kukis' victory
entries.description: Cook Islands power back from a half-time deficit to edge Wales in their Rugby League World Cup opener in Leigh.

entries.title: Liverpool 1-0 West Ham: Darwin Nunez scores his first Anfield goal for Reds
entries.description: Darwin Nunez scores his first Anfield goal for Liverpool and Alisson saves a penalty as the Reds defeat West Ham in an incident-packed encounter.

entries.title: WATCH: 'I've had enough of talentless people' - Charles Walker
entries.description: The veteran politician spoke candidly with the BBC about his frustrations with the government.

entries.title: Rory McIlroy: World number two rejects Phil Mickelson 'winning side' comments on LIV
entries.description: Rory McIlroy rejects Phil Mickelson's suggestion that he has picked the "winning side" in the dispute between the LIV series and PGA Tour.

entries.title: LS Lowry's Going To The Match sells for £7.8m at auction
entries.description: The sale of the artwork, described as an "iconic masterpiece", means it will remain on public display.

entries.title: Friends could be key to finding fitness motivation
entries.description: Spending time with active people could be key to kick-starting a workout regime, research suggests.

entries.title: Labour MP alleges bullying during fracking vote
entries.description: Chris Bryant calls for an investigation into the scenes in Parliament after a vote on fracking.

entries.title: Mark Drakeford: A brief history of political rants
entries.description: When Mark Drakeford exploded at the Tories, it was not the first time a politician had seen red.

entries.title: Les Ferdinand: FA diversity code 'made no change' in helping black players get jobs in football
entries.description: QPR director of football Les Ferdinand says black players are not being helped to get jobs in the game by the FA's Football Leadership plan.

entries.title: Grants Shapps replaces Suella Braverman as home secretary
entries.description: Suella Braverman quits, using her resignation letter to attack the government's "broken pledges".

entries.title: Two charged following Dartford bridge protests
entries.description: Climate change activists climbed the QEII bridge at Dartford leading to disruption on the M25.

entries.title: Suella Braverman: Home Secretary's resignation letter in full
entries.description: The home secretary resigned after sending official documents from an unsecured email address.

entries.title: BBC Food's vegetarian family £1 recipe meal plan
entries.description: This budget-friendly veggie meal plan covers a week's worth of dinners for four adults, coming in at under £28 in total.

entries.title: Bank of England wasn't briefed on mini-budget
entries.description: The government did not tell the Bank about its tax cut plans, says deputy governor Sir Jon Cunliffe.

entries.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan: Seven-time world champion lacks 'passion and desire' for snooker
entries.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan tells BBC Sport snooker has "become like an emotionless type job" after his second-round defeat by David Grace at the Northern Ireland Open.

entries.title: Fact-checking Liz Truss at PMQs
entries.description: Looking at claims about energy bills, NHS backlogs and interest rates.

entries.title: Ukrainian troops under close gunfire
entries.description: War in eastern Ukraine involves not only artillery strikes, but close combat, as the BBC's Jonathan Beale finds.

entries.title: Pensions: Liz Truss commits to triple lock after concern from Tory MPs
entries.description: Liz Truss's spokesman had said she was "not making any commitments" on raising pensions with prices.

entries.title: Barnsley paedophile to jet off on holiday before sentencing
entries.description: Matthew Thompson is given leave to take a pre-booked holiday in Kos despite admitting 10 offences.

entries.title: James Webb telescope spies 'Pillars of Creation'
entries.description: One of the most famous scenes in the cosmos is viewed by the new, Nasa-led super space observatory.

entries.title: Government makes fracking ban vote test of Tory loyalty
entries.description: Tory MPs are told to oppose a move to ban fracking in a vote to demonstrate Liz Truss's authority.

entries.title: What next for women's boxing? Shields v Marshall II; three-minute rounds; big fights on horizon
entries.description: BBC Sport looks at what comes next for women's boxing after Claressa Shields v Savannah Marshall, as well as the big fights already confirmed for the end of the year.

entries.title: Under-pressure Putin 'doubles down' with security decree
entries.description: Vladimir Putin is tightening security across Russia, with the introduction of different security levels.

entries.title: ATP Tour: Cameron Norrie beats Aslan Karatsev in Stockholm Open & Dan Evans progresses in Antwerp
entries.description: British number one Cameron Norrie returns to action with victory over Russia's Aslan Karatsev at the Stockholm Open as Dan Evans progresses in Antwerp.

entries.title: Scotland: Finn Russell left out of autumn squad as Jamie Ritchie named captain
entries.description: Finn Russell has been left out of Scotland's squad for the upcoming autumn series, while Jamie Ritchie has been named captain.

entries.title: Mum faces £17,000 energy bill to keep disabled daughter alive
entries.description: Freya Hunter, 12, has severe cerebral palsy and relies on oxygen at home for breathing problems.

entries.title: I was dragged into Chinese consulate grounds - protester
entries.description: Hong Kong pro-democracy protester Bob Chan gives his account of violent scenes at China's consulate in Manchester.

entries.title: Bangladesh deaths: Fourth Cardiff family member dies
entries.description: A woman whose husband and two children were killed by suspected carbon monoxide poisoning has died.

entries.title: A feisty PMQs... in just 50 seconds
entries.description: As questions are asked about her future, Liz Truss faces Keir Starmer in the House of Commons.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: England win over Samoa 'shut a few people up'
entries.description: In his BBC Sport column, England's George Williams hopes the crushing win against Samoa lifts fans' belief for the World Cup.

entries.title: Cost of Living: Teen quits college to help mum pay bills
entries.description: The 17-year-old says she felt her "only option" was to quit college to help her mum struggling alone.

entries.title: How did jet crash into a block of flats in Russia?
entries.description: An investigation is underway into the crash of a fighter jet into a block of flats in Russia.

entries.title: Sex assault victim calls for cricket abuse inquiry
entries.description: A man who was sexually assaulted by a former Durham coach as a child calls for an independent inquiry into abuse within the sport.

entries.title: Liz Truss' special adviser suspended and faces investigation
entries.description: Jason Stein is to face a formal investigation by the Propriety and Ethics Team, the BBC understands.

entries.title: Great British Railways transport bill shelved
entries.description: The transport secretary admits the full plan for overhauling how the railways are run will be delayed.

entries.title: Why are you still here, Keir Starmer asks Liz Truss
entries.description: At a stormy PMQs, the Labour leader calls on Liz Truss to resign, but she says "I am fighter, not a quitter".

entries.title: Pensions: What is the triple lock?
entries.description: Prime Minister Liz Truss says she is "completely committed" to the triple lock.

entries.title: Police investigate damage to Man City's team coach
entries.description: The windscreen was damaged following City's 1-0 defeat to Liverpool at Anfield.

entries.title: Sweden ditches 'feminist foreign policy'
entries.description: The new foreign minister said the label had become more important than its content.

entries.title: East Kent maternity deaths: Babies may have survived with better care
entries.description: A review into East Kent NHS Trust finds up to 45 babies may have survived with better care.

entries.title: Liz Truss: What do Conservative Party members think?
entries.description: Conservative Party members give their verdict on the prime minister after a tumultuous few weeks.

entries.title: Soaring food prices push inflation to 40-year high
entries.description: The price of bread, cereals, meat and other key foods surged in the year to September.

entries.title: NBA: LeBron James & Steph Curry both star as Golden State Warriors beat Los Angeles Lakers
entries.description: Steph Curry and LeBron James both score more than 30 points as the Golden State Warriors beat the Los Angeles Lakers in the NBA season opener.

entries.title: Liz Truss: What the world is saying about UK turmoil
entries.description: BBC reporters around the globe explain how the political and economic upheaval is being viewed.

entries.title: Devon head teacher brings in mother to help cash-strapped school
entries.description: "It is mission impossible" as staff quit for better paid supermarket jobs, he says.

entries.title: Great Scottish Run 150m short: Eilish McColgan records invalidated
entries.description: The 10,000m records set by Eilish McColgan in the Great Scottish Run are invalidated after the course is found to be 150m short.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Russia begins evacuation from Kherson in south
entries.description: Thousands of civilians and officials will be moved in Kherson region because of Ukraine's offensive.

entries.title: Leah Heyes: MDMA death teen's mother fronts anti-drug campaign
entries.description: The mother of Leah Heyes,, 15, who died after taking MDMA is urging families to talk about drugs.

entries.title: Mason Greenwood granted bail over attempted rape charge
entries.description: Manchester United footballer Mason Greenwood is granted bail following a private hearing.

entries.title: Asos says shoppers spending less on clothes
entries.description: The online fashion retailer says it is feeling the pain of a shrinking UK economy.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: England's Reece Topley set to be out of tournament with ankle injury
entries.description: England bowler Reece Topley is set to be ruled out of the T20 World Cup with an ankle injury, three days before his side's tournament opener on Saturday.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Ireland stun Scotland with Hobart comeback
entries.description: Ireland keep alive their hopes of progressing at the Men's T20 World Cup with a stunning comeback to beat Scotland by six wickets in Hobart.

entries.title: Pensions: Minister can't give certainty over triple lock
entries.description: The PM had pledged to keep the triple lock - but now will not make any commitments on spending.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Ireland seal remarkable win over Scotland with Campher four
entries.description: Watch as Curtis Campher hits a four to secure a remarkable win for Ireland over Scotland at the T20 World Cup in Hobart, Australia.

entries.title: Sanna Irshad Mattoo: Pulitzer-winning Kashmiri journalist stopped from leaving India
entries.description: Kashmiri photojournalist Sanna Irshad Mattoo was due to attend the award ceremony in the US.

entries.title: NHS front line: On the road with an ambulance crew
entries.description: The BBC joins a West Midlands Ambulance Service crew for a day as they respond to emergencies.

entries.title: Champions League: Can Women's Super League clubs compete with Europe's elite?
entries.description: Arsenal and Chelsea are two of the best teams in England, but are they finally at the point where they can compete with Europe's elite?

entries.title: NBA: Stephen Curry scores 33 points as Warriors beat Lakers in season opener
entries.description: Stephen Curry scores 33 points as the Golden State Warriors begin the defence of their NBA title with a 123-109 win over the Los Angeles Lakers.

entries.title: Jurgen Klopp: Liverpool manager says his Man City comments were not xenophobic
entries.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says he would "hate it" if his comments about Manchester City's spending power were seen as xenophobic.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Scotland's Michael Jones hits six on to roof
entries.description: Scotland opener Michael Jones hits a huge six on to the roof of the Blundstone Arena during their T20 World Cup match against Ireland in Hobart, Australia.

entries.title: England: Nick Pope and Aaron Ramsdale hoping to usurp Jordan Pickford at World Cup
entries.description: With Gareth Southgate naming his provisional England World Cup squad on Thursday, BBC Sport takes a look at the goalkeeping options.

entries.title: Google offers glimpse of ultra-realistic chat tech
entries.description: Earlier this year, the company fired an engineer who claimed the Lamda AI language system had feelings.

entries.title: Race hate crimes: Victim of nightclub attacks calls for harsher punishments
entries.description: Ebehitale Igene was attacked three times in a nightclub, with footage posted on social media.

entries.title: How Paralympic couple found out about pregnancy in supermarket
entries.description: British wheelchair basketball stars Laurie Williams and Robyn Love discuss starting a family - and how they found out about their pregnancy in a supermarket.

entries.title: Renting in London: 'I can't afford my own place'
entries.description: Tace McWilliam says she won't be able to afford to live alone for a long time.

entries.title: Netflix: How did the streaming service turn its fortunes around?
entries.description: The streamer has grown its subscriber base after two consecutive quarters of losses.

entries.title: Elnaz Rekabi: Iranian climber flies home to crowds of supporters
entries.description: Athlete Elnaz Rekabi arrives in Tehran to chants of "heroine" after competing without a hair covering.

entries.title: HSBC climate change adverts banned by UK watchdog
entries.description: The regulator said the bank "omitted significant information" about its contribution to harmful emissions.
